page.title: 05Housing - a rural community
page.content: On the north western area of the block on the main road leading from Yarmouth is a row of mainly older houses facing seawards with views across the Solent. Most were quite big and we thought would be expensive to buy. They were of different styles and some looked older than others. Further along the road was a group of very new houses built of red brick. These were all very big and had obviously been built about the same time. They all had big windows which looked out across the water. Along the road still further on the seawards side was a very big old house standing in big grounds. This old house we discovered used to be a special school for difficult children but we learned that the school was to expensive to run and had been sold by the council.
